sect3.title: Weblog Administration
sect3.para: The Blog system administration page can be found from the main menu of the Visual Server Administration Interface by expanding through: Web Services >> Weblog.
This page lists all users that have a blog account enabled. Blog users are created using the WebDAV Users Administration page and a few more options, as shown below.

Community blogging can be activated using the Generate WebSite Pages button. This will generate a DAV owned blog site that will host other blogs within a community. It can be configured to allow anyone to register and begin blogging and/or existing blogs can be added to the community by making sure they are part of the same domain (see User Settings below).

figure.title: Weblog UI - Adding a WebDAV User with Weblog Support

sect3.para: You create or edit WebDAV users in the usual way, but to enable blog support you must supply the following:

simplelist.member: Create home directory - check box must be enabled
Home Directory - must be supplied to a location in DAV, preferably /DAV/<blog-username>/.
Create Weblog - must also be checked.

sect3.para: Having met this criteria the interface will save the details and create the default blog site within the home directory. Once details have been set or confirmed you should return the Blog Administration page to review the Blog User Settings, below:

sect3.title: Weblog User Settings
sect3.para: The user settings here are the same as those presented for the community blog (see later), only the layout is different. These settings configure your blog site.

formalpara.title: Title
formalpara.para: The front page title for the blog home page.

formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: The description that will be accompanied with meta-data about the site, such as contained within RSS feeds.

formalpara.title: Author's e-mail
formalpara.para: The email address of the blog author. This can be used for receiving notifications.

formalpara.title: Owner
formalpara.para: The WebDAV owner for the site. This is supplied as read-only for reference only.

formalpara.title: Home page URL
formalpara.para: If the blog user has another home page it can be supplied here for blog readers to visit. A valid URL should be supplied.

formalpara.title: Copyrights; Disclaimers
formalpara.para: Should the blog user wish to supply such details they can do so here, in plain-text.

formalpara.title: Keywords
formalpara.para: These are HTML META TAG keyword values for the Blog Home Page; these are typically used by search engines amongst other "web spiders" to determine page and keyword associations.

formalpara.title: Upload Photo Image; Photo
formalpara.para: You can supply a photo that will provide your site with a graphical identity. Use the browse button to select an image to upload. Uploaded images are placed in the blog subdirectory of the users home. You may have more than one image in this directory so you must enter the filename of photo you want displayed in the "Photo" field, relative to the blog subdirectory.

formalpara.title: XSL-T filter for Posts
formalpara.para: The *default* option can be replaced should a custom stylesheet be supplied for handling post output. The filename and path relative to the <home-dir>/blog directory should be supplied.

formalpara.title: Domains
formalpara.para: This selects the domains (on the left) that will provide access to the blog site. This option can be used to enable access to a single blog from a variety of personal, community, and corporate domains, which may be hosted on the same Virtuoso server instance using Virtuoso's Virtual Host/Domain functionality.

formalpara.title: Weblog pings
formalpara.para: Enables automatic blog post notification to the central blog post server at http://weblogs.com/. This is one of the way of making the blogosphere aware of your blog posts.

formalpara.title: Enable Contacts
formalpara.para: This is how you add records to the Virtuoso Weblog subsystem's FOAF (Friend of A Friend) database. The FOAF database like other weblog gems is exposed to the web and blogosphere via a SQL-XML based RDF file. FOAF is an application of the XML based RDF vocabulary for persisting and sharing information about your contacts and associates.

formalpara.title: RSS file version
formalpara.para: To maximize compatibility with existing RSS aware technologies (e.g. RSS Headline Readers and RSS Content Aggregators) a choice of RSS formats provided for your blog posts (the system default is RSS 2.0).

formalpara.title: Enable Comments
formalpara.para: When enabled allows readers of your blog to provide comments on your site directly.

formalpara.title: Enable Comment Post Notification via E-mail
formalpara.para: When checked you will receive an e-mail notification (using the blog e-mail account value provided above) every time a comment is posted to your blog.

formalpara.title: Time-zone
formalpara.para: Allows you to set your time-zone.

formalpara.title: Bridge Settings
formalpara.para: Allows you to define upstreaming destinations and rules. Upstreaming is how you enable Virtuoso to automatically route blog posts to other blogs that you may own, the only requirement is that these blog systems support any one of the following blog post APIs: Blogger, Meta-Weblog, or Moveable Type. This also implies that you can use a single Blog Post Client (w.Bloggar, Newzcrawler, Zempt, and others) to post to several blogs. See Community Blog Upstreaming below, the settings are identical.

formalpara.title: Categories
formalpara.para: Provides a simple interface for creating blog post categories. It is important to note that the "enabled" and "disabled" attributes of these categories determines if they allow upstreaming of posts of not. Thus, when a category is set to "disabled" it means that any post that falls into this category will not be upstreamed to blogs outside the current server. When a category is set to "enabled" it means that although posts are not automatically restricted to the host server, they may still be excluded from upstreaming via an exception rule in an upstream routing table.

formalpara.title: Channels
formalpara.para: Use this page to add RSS, OPML, OCS feeds to your blog home page. The OPML and OCS feeds contain collections of RSS feeds (these are Group Syndication Formats), and each RSS feed may or may not be a blog feed. In cases where the feed is deemed to be a blog (you indicate this by checking the "Is This a Blog" checkbox), it will be saved to Virtuoso's WebDAV repository and automatically added to the blog home's "Blogroll", otherwise they will be added to the "Channelroll" section of the blog home page - which enumerates a collection RSS based content sources.

formalpara.title: Contacts
formalpara.para: Your electronic contact details are provided here.

sect3.title: Weblog Posting
sect3.para: This interface allows you to post blog entries to selected categories at a particular time. You supply a title for the post and the main content in the description field. The preview option lets you see how it will look without actually posting anything to the blog.

This is how the default generated blog home page will look. This is completely customizable via XSL's and VSPX code that is copied into your blog directory in DAV without effecting other blogs. You postings for the day will be displayed in the centre column, you can select other days using the calendar in the top right of the page. Along the left column you have syndication options to your site, a collection of XML based feeds, such as RSS for other blog users to keep track of your blogging.
As the blog site grows in complexity, your channels and RSS feeds will be listed on the right-hand column of the page.

sect3.title: Community Blog Posting
sect3.para: The community blog site providers a login section in the top-left of the page. Once a user is logged-in they can continue blogging as normal, but using the same "skin" as the home page. Hence, the Community Blog Entry page that contains similar fields for authoring a blog post.

note.title: Note:
note.para: The left-hand column contains a configuration panel, used by bloggers to maintain their part of the community.

formalpara.title: Channel Subscriptions
formalpara.para: For subscribing to news feeds and other RSS's.

formalpara.title: Upstreaming
formalpara.para: So that your blogs on this community can be replicated to other blogs.

formalpara.title: Categories
formalpara.para: For maintaining your blog categories.

formalpara.title: Preferences
formalpara.para: For configuring you blog site details.

sect3.title: Community Blog - Categories
sect3.para: This page lets you define, remove and edit your blog categories. You provide a description and use the drop-down list to choose whether you want the category to be included in any upstreaming configurations. Click on the save button to add the category.

It is important to note that the "enabled" and "disabled" attributes of these categories determines if they allow upstreaming of posts of not. Thus, when a category is set to "disabled" it means that any post that falls into this category will not be upstreamed to blogs outside the current server. When a category is set to "enabled" it means that although posts are not automatically restricted to the host server, they may still be excluded from upstreaming via an exception rule in an upstream routing table.
Existing categories will be listed in a table on this page, the edit link lets you alter its details, whilst the delete link lets you drop a category.
You post to a category by selecting it from the list next to the blog post description.

sect3.title: Community Blog - Channel Subscription
sect3.para: This page is used to add RSS, OPML, OCS feeds to your blog home page. The OPML and OCS feeds contain collections of RSS feeds (these are Group Syndication Formats), and each RSS feed may or may not be a blog feed. In cases where the feed is deemed to be a blog (you indicate this by checking the "Is This a Blog" checkbox), it will be saved to Virtuoso's WebDAV repository and automatically added to the blog home's "Blogroll", otherwise they will be added to the "Channelroll" section of the blog home page - which enumerates a collection RSS based content sources.
The channel subscription page lists in a table any RSS based feeds that have been subscribed to, and lets you add entries to that list.

figure.title: Weblog UI - Community Channel Subscription Settings

sect3.para: To add a channel to the list simply supply the URL to the RSS feed itself and click on retrieve. After the RSS feed has been reviewed you will be presented with its details to review and confirm using the Save button, thus adding it to the list.

figure.title: Weblog UI - Community Channel Subscription Confirmation

sect3.para: For each item in the list you can:

formalpara.title: Edit
formalpara.para: Its details, such as its update interval.

formalpara.title: Delete
formalpara.para: The entry altogether.

formalpara.title: Fetch Posts
formalpara.para: To fetch the latest RSS version from the server on demand, now.

sect3.title: Community Blog - Upstreaming
sect3.para: Upstreaming keeps your blogs synchronized amongst your various blog sites, should you have more than one. This allows you to maintain all of your blogging centrally, and then upstream portions to appropriate servers based on whether they are private, public or for your organization or of various topics.

Upstreaming is how you enable Virtuoso to automatically route blog posts to other blogs that you may own, the only requirement is that these blog systems support any one of the following blog post APIs: Blogger, Meta-Weblog, or Moveable Type. This also implies that you can use a single Blog Post Client (w.Bloggar, Newzcrawler, Zempt, and others) to post to several blogs.

formalpara.title: Endpoint
formalpara.para: Is the XML-RPC/SOAP endpoint that support SOAP based blogger API for your blog site. For Virtuoso servers the endpoint typically ends with /RPC2, but this is configurable.

formalpara.title: User/Password
formalpara.para: The credentials required for accessing your blog site.

formalpara.title: Type
formalpara.para: The Blog API system type. One of: Blogger, MetaWebLog or Moveable Type

formalpara.title: BlogID
formalpara.para: The system ID for your blog account on the server. This is rarely known so the Fetch button can be used to obtain it once the above information has been provided.

formalpara.title: Frequency
formalpara.para: The interval in minutes that Virtuoso will re-sync your blog with other sites.

formalpara.title: Except
formalpara.para: Is an exception list to remove categories from this upstream entry.

formalpara.title: Action
formalpara.para: The final step for adding your upstreaming entry is the Add button. The checkbox next to it can be toggled to activate or de-activate an upstream entry as required.

formalpara.para: Toggle to specify whether you want to display referral URL's on your blog page.

formalpara.para: Lets you change your password. You have your old password in order to do this for security purposes.
